pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [46f70fddb8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21441/commits/46f70fddb851e8c7b5aa46082d1a70f3c7efc6eb)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsProper.of_comp_of_isSeparated`
`+ RingHom.finite_of_algHom_finiteType_of_isJacobsonRing`
`+ UniversallyClosed.of_comp_of_isSeparated`
`+ finite_appTop_of_universallyClosed`
`+ finite_of_algHom_finiteType_of_isJacobsonRing`
`+ instance (priority := 100) [IsFinite f] : IsProper f`
`+ instance [IsProper f] [IsProper g] : IsProper (f â‰« g)`
`+ isField_of_universallyClosed`
`+ isIntegral_appTop_of_universallyClosed`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Just to check: the literal statement in the PR description (using `IsProper`) is proved by typeclass inference? Anyway this is great, thanks a lot!

bors d+

:v: erdOne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> Just to check: the literal statement in the PR description (using IsProper) is proved by typeclass inference?

Yes.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13347310614/job/37279341223)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13347310614/job/37279341352)

```suggestion
and of finite type over `Spec K`) form a finite field extension of the base field.
```

I don't think this theorem is literally due to Liouville â€“Â he died in 1882 and universally closed morphisms of schemes are definitely a mid-20th-century concept. What Liouville actually proved was that a bounded complex-analytic function is constant; I'm pretty sure this is what the "average mathematician" would understand by "Liouville's theorem", and we already have it as [Differentiable.exists_eq_const_of_bounded](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/Complex/Liouville.html#Differentiable.exists_eq_const_of_bounded) (whose docstring describes it as "Liouville's theorem" and which lives in a file called `Mathlib.Analysis.Complex.Liouville`). So I would suggest changing the name and title of this file (and this PR!) to avoid confusing people who are searching the docs for the complex-analytic version.
Fair point. I have moved it into `Proper.lean` due to the lack of a better file name. It should be fine as it is only ~50 lines and does not need any new import.

"Universally closed" isn't part of the definition of "variety" (while "integral" and "finite type" are), so I suggest something like
"if `X` is a variety over a field `K` (i.e. an integral scheme of finite type over `Spec K`), and `X` is universally closed, then the global sections of the structure sheaf of `X` are a finite field extension of `K`."

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): Global sections of proper varieties
